seoDescription: International Blockchain Olympiad is a multidisciplinary design and building competition. IBCOL 2019 invites students from around the world to solve real-world challenges through decentralized applications.
subhead: Registration for the 2019 International Blockchain Olympiad
eligibilityGeneral: A student is defined as a person enroled in good standing at a recognized secondary or post-secondary academic institution, or if graduated from a recognized secondary or post-secondary academic institution within the last 2 years.
eligibilityCategory: Students are categorized as secondary or post-secondary students based on their student identity documents at the time of registration.
eligibilityTeam: Students may only be registered to one team; if a student is involved with a team other than their own, they would be considered an advisor to that other team, and a contestant to their primary team.

plans.specialNotice: Except additional category fees, project registration fees for team registrations are waived for all registered teams until April 1st 2019

teamExplained: Up to 6 students can register into one team
projectExplained: A team can submit more than one project
categoryExplained: Each project is entered into a category
